definition[0]: a ticket that can be used instead of money for a particular purpose
example[0]: The voucher can be used at most major supermarkets.
example[1]: First prize is a £1,000 travel voucher.
definition[1]: an official statement or receipt that is given to someone to prove that their accounts are correct or that money has been paid
example[2]: The tour price includes a voucher for a meal in a pub of your choice.
example[3]: She was given a travel voucher from Belfast to London.
definition[2]: money that a government gives people to use for a particular purpose such as health or education
example[4]: The White House is proposing tax credits or vouchers, worth perhaps as much as $5,000 a family, to help low-income people buy health insurance.
example[5]: The nursery voucher scheme gave parents vouchers worth £1000 to buy the nursery provision of their choice.
definition[3]: an official RECEIPT given for money that has been paid
example[6]: On receiving payment the subcontractor should give the builder a completed voucher.
definition[4]: any document that proves that someone’s accounts are correct
